factoid: Pierre half rose.
Pierre intended to go round.
The aunt handed Pierre the snuffbox.
The aunt passed the snuffbox across Hélène’s back.
Hélène stooped forward to make room.
Hélène looked round with a smile.
Hélène was wearing a fashionable dress.
Hélène’s dress was cut very low at the front.
Hélène’s dress was cut very low at the back.
Pierre had always perceived Hélène’s bust as marble.
Hélène’s bust was close to Pierre.
Pierre’s shortsighted eyes perceived the living charm of Hélène’s neck and shoulders.
Hélène’s neck and shoulders were so near to Pierre’s lips that Pierre could touch them by bending his head a little.
Pierre was conscious of the warmth of Hélène’s body.
Pierre was conscious of the scent of Hélène’s perfume.
Pierre was conscious of the creaking of Hélène’s corset as she moved.
Pierre did not see Hélène’s marble beauty forming a complete whole with her dress.
The charm of Hélène’s body was covered only by her garments.
Having once seen this, Pierre could not help being aware of it.
Hélène seemed to say, “So you have never noticed before how beautiful I am?”
Hélène said, “You had not noticed that I am a woman? Yes, I am a woman who may belong to anyone—to you too.”
At that moment Pierre felt that Hélène could be his wife.
At that moment Pierre felt that Hélène must be his wife.
Pierre felt that it could not be otherwise.
Pierre knew this at that moment as surely as if he had been standing at the altar with Hélène.
Pierre did not know how this would be.
Pierre did not know when this would be.
Pierre did not even know if this would be a good thing.
Pierre knew that this would happen.
Pierre dropped his eyes.
Pierre lifted his eyes again.
Pierre wished once more to see Hélène as a distant beauty far removed from him.
Pierre had seen Hélène as a distant beauty far removed from him every day until then.
Pierre could no longer see Hélène as a distant beauty far removed from him.
Pierre could not again consider Hélène as a distant beauty after recognizing her close.
Hélène was terribly close to Pierre.
Hélène already had power over Pierre.
Between Pierre and Hélène there was no longer any barrier except the barrier of Pierre’s own will.
Anna Pávlovna said, “Well, I will leave you in your little corner. I see you are all right there.”
Pierre looked round with a blush.
Pierre anxiously tried to remember whether he had done anything reprehensible.
Pierre thought that everyone knew what had happened to him as he knew it himself.
Pierre went up to the large circle.
Anna Pávlovna said to Pierre, “I hear you are refitting your Petersburg house?”
The statement that Pierre was refitting his Petersburg house was true.
The architect told Pierre that refitting his Petersburg house was necessary.
Pierre was having his enormous Petersburg house done up without knowing why.
Anna Pávlovna said, “That’s a good thing, but don’t move from Prince Vasíli’s.”
Anna said that it is good to have a friend like Prince Vasíli.
Anna smiled at Prince Vasíli.
Anna said, “I know something about that. Don’t I? And you are still so…”
Anna said, “You need advice. Don’t be angry with me for exercising an old woman’s privilege.”
Anna paused, expecting something after mentioning her age.
Anna said, “If you marry it will be a different thing.”
Pierre did not look at Hélène.
Hélène did not look at Pierre.
Pierre muttered something and colored.
Pierre could not sleep for a long time after he got home.
Pierre was thinking of what had happened.
Nothing had happened.
Pierre had understood that the woman he had known as a child had been considered by her beauty.
